page.title: 05CHINA CLAY: CHANGES
page.content:
The china clay industry has changed dramatically since it started in 1748. It has become fully automated and highly technical. Whereas in the past the Cornish quarry worker had to use picks and long-handled shovels to get at the clay-bearing rock, now he uses high powered water jets capable of exerting pressures of 300 pounds per square inch.
Traditionally, until the 1950's, pit ponies carried clay in carts to the ports. today, the clay is piped as slurry or carried by large lorries.
Most workers think that things have tended to change for the better, making the job safer and less arduous. However, some things remain the same, like the traditional cup of tea and snack in the "crib" hut.
